results.title: Men in black
results.creator_credit: Amblin Entertainment, MacDonald Parkes Productions, Walter Parkes, Laurie MacDonald and Barry Sonenfield
results.brief_description: The talents behind this special effects bonanza are onto something special - lovely laser-keen wit that comes at warp speed, with modesty and effortless cool. With a new alien critter roughly every 10 minutes - only the sheer presence of the main actors Tommy Lee Jones and Wil Smith keeps them from being upstaged. They are the best kept secret in the universe, their mission is to monitor extra-terrestrial activity on earth. They are our best, last and only line of defence. They work in secret, they exist in shadow - they are the Men in Black! Based on the comic by Lowell Cunningham.

results.title: The Crucible
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Hytner, David V. Picker, Robert Miller and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: She afflicts me! She comes to me at night and torments me! She’s a witch! In the Puritan village of Salem Massachusetts in 1692, these words provoked fear and terror in the hearts of the townspeople. Behind these accusations lie the covenance of a neighbours land and a girl who will stop at nothing to capture the heart of a married man. This screenplay is penned by Arthur Miller and based on his play of the same name. He skillfully recreates a real-life story, combining intrigue, romance and suspense of the infamous Salem Witch Trials. Cast includes Daniel Day-Lewis, Winona Ryder, Paul Scofield, Joan Allen, Bruce Davidson, Rob Campbell and Jeffrey Jones. A study guide accompanies this tape.

results.title: The Long kiss goodnight (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Renny Harlin, Shane Black, Stephanie Austin, Steve Tisch and Forge
results.brief_description: Samantha Cain (Geena Davis) is a school teacher who for the past 8 years has suffered amnesia. Haunted by bizarre flashbacks, she hires private detective Mitch (Samuel L. Jackson), to discover her true identity. They discover that Samantha is actually a lethal government assassin, presumed dead and that’s the way the authorities would like to keep it. Samantha is now hunted by her past and a string of government agents who have placed a contract on her life and kidnapped her daughter.

results.title: Through a glass darkly
results.creator_credit: Ingmar Bergman, Allan Ekelund and Svensk Filmindustri
results.brief_description: Bergman’s “Through a glass darkly” centres on the lives of four characters. Karen (Harriet Andersson) suffers from schizophrenia and has just returned from hospital. She lives on a remote island in the Baltic with her husband Martin (Max Von Sydow) and brother Minus (Lars Passgard). David (Gunnar Bjornstrand), their father, is a novelist who returns from Switzerland to visit them. Gradually the severity of Karen’s illness becomes apparent to them all. Despite it’s dark subject matter “Through a glass darkly” is mesmerising to watch thanks to the outstanding performances by the four actors as well Sven Nykvist’s beautiful cinematography. Winner of 1961 Academy Award for Best Foreign Film. In Swedish with english subtitles.

results.title: Scenes from a marriage
results.brief_description: A passionate, probing and honest look at a marriage, its disintegration and the relationship that follows. Liv Ullman and Erland Josephson are remarkable throughout this intimate and often painful portrait which Bergamn originally made as 6 50 minute episodes for television and subsequently edited into a full-length feature. Bergman examines the trauma of a beleagured marriage largely in close-up creating an exhaustive study of the doubt, despair, confusion and loneliness experienced by Marianne on discovering her husband’s infidelity with a younger woman. Swedish language with English subtitles.

results.title: Jungfrukallan = The Virgin Spring
results.brief_description: Bergman won his first Academy Award for this brooding medieval tale based in an old Swedish ballad, closely comparable with the ‘Seventh seal’, examining the conflict between Christianity and pagnism rife throughout the Middle Ages. Set in beautiful 14th Century Sweden, it is the sombre, powerful fable of peasant parents (Max Von Sydow and Birgitta Valberg) whose daughter, a young virgin is brutally raped and murdered by swineherds after her half sister has invoked a pagan curse. By a bizarre twist of fate the murderers ask for food and shelter from the dead girl’s parents, who, discovering the truth about their lodgers, exact a chilling revenge. A cruel and sensational allegory, a tale of superstition, religious fervour, muurder and revenge, the formal simplicity and overt symbolism conspire to create an extraordinary metaphysical charge, aided by the the luminous, haunting black and white photography and Bergman’s meticulous direction.

results.title: To forget Venice = Dimenticare Venezia
results.creator_credit: Franco Busati, Vivien Boder, Ennio DiMeo, Action Films and Rizzoli Film
results.brief_description: An old country house in Venice is inhabited by four women: Aunt Martha (Eleonora Giorgi), a widowed one-time opera singer; Anna, her adopted niece (Mariangela Melato); Claudia, a school teacher and Caterina, an elderly servant. One weekend they receive a visit from Nicky (Erland Josephson), Aunt Martha’s brother who lived there as a child, and his friend Picchio. A collision of characters takes place with frailty, immaturity and rejection all surfacing at once. The death of Aunt Martha provides the catalyst for each individual to re-evaluate themselves and consequently provide the incentive to forget the past and start a new life. In Italian with English sub-titles.

results.title: Alfredo Alfredo
results.creator_credit: Pietro Germi, Gugliemo Colonna and Rizzoli Film
results.brief_description: Alfredo Alfredo is a side-splitting comedy about the trials and tribulations of marriage. Alfredo Sbisa (Dustin Hoffman) is a shy young bank clerk who stumbles into a relationship with the girl of his dreams, Maria Rosa. His dreams take on a surreal tone as he is drawn deeper into a relationship with her. Who is this infathomable woman he has married? Alfredo starts to dream of an escape. Pietro Germi cleverly uses Hoffman’s gift for physical comedy, minimising his dialogue (which is dubbed by Ferruccio Amendola). In Italian with english subtitles.

results.title: Don Bosco
results.creator_credit: Leandro Castellani, Alfio Sugaroni and Rizzoli Film
results.brief_description: Born a peasant in Turin, Don Bosco (Ben Gazzara) has always known his vocation, thanks to an extremely significant dream. He welcomes poor, abandoned boys to his oratory and promptly teaches them to be charitable in accordance with the Christian doctrine. His power to sway souls away from the perils of greed and avarice frightens many people who repeatedly try to stop him, but without success. Self-assured, Don Bosco decides to found a congregation with its own rules but still has to contend with pressure from the Arch-Bishop of Turin.

results.title: Summer with Monika = Sommaren med Monika
results.creator_credit: Ingmar Bergman, Allan Ekelund and Svensk Filmindustri
results.brief_description: When Harry (Lars Ekborg) meets Monika (Harriet Andersson) in a cafe they soon fall in love. Monika leaves home after an argument with her father and the young lovers run away on Harry’s father’s boat. They spend a carefree summer on the boat until Monika discovers she is pregnant and they are forced to return to Stockholm. As a married couple struggling to make a living Harry and Monika soon find their love disintegrating. Once again, Ingmar Bergman totally engrosses us in this sensitive study of young love, eliciting great performances from Lars Ekborg as the ernest Harry and Harriet Andersson as the wild and willful Monika. In Swedish with English subtitles.
